pageContext.claim: “I will always protect your Social Security, your Medicare, and your Medicaid. We're protecting Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid, and I always will.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has largely left Social Security untouched and savings he has sought on Medicare spending mostly mirrored proposals advanced by Barack Obama. But he goes too far to claim he would protect Medicaid, the health-care program for the poor. During the debate over repealing the Affordable Care Act in 2017, Trump supported proposals that would have federal spending on Medicaid by $772 billion over 10 years, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, 15 million fewer people would have been enrolled in the program over 10 years than would be under current law.
